Container.Name: binhex-deluge
Container.Overview: Deluge is a full-featured BitTorrent client for Linux, OS X, Unix and Windows. It uses libtorrent in its backend and features multiple user-interfaces including: GTK+, web and console. It has been designed using the client server model with a daemon process that handles all the bittorrent activity. The Deluge daemon is able to run on headless machines with the user-interfaces being able to connect remotely from any platform.
Container.DonateText: If you appreciate my work, then please consider buying me a beer :D

Config.Name: Port: Web Interface
Config.Description: This is the Web UI port for for the application.

Config.Name: Port: Deluge daemon
Config.Description: This is the port used by the Deluge daemon.

Config.Name: Port: Incoming port (TCP)
Config.Description: This port can be used as an TCP incoming port.

Config.Name: Port: Incoming port (UDP)
Config.Description: This port can be used as an UDP incoming port.

Config.Name: Path: /config
Config.Description: This is the container path to your configuration files, e.g. databases, configuration files, logs etc.

Config.Name: Path: /data
Config.Description: This is the container path to your downloaded files or user created content.

Config.Name: Variable: DELUGE_DAEMON_LOG_LEVEL
Config.Description: Specify the level of logging for the Deluge daemon, valid levels are: info, warning, error, none, debug, trace, garbage.

Config.Name: Variable: DELUGE_WEB_LOG_LEVEL
Config.Description: Specify the level of logging for the Deluge daemon, valid levels are: info, warning, error, none, debug, trace, garbage.

Config.Name: Variable: SHARED_NETWORK
Config.Description: Specify whether this container is sharing the network with another VPN container, if set to 'yes' then this container will stop when the VPN container is stopped.

Config.Name: Variable: PUID
Config.Description: User ID for the running container

Config.Name: Variable: PGID
Config.Description: Group ID for the running container
